intro: Salvia verapazana, commonly known as the Verapaz sage, is a perennial herb native to Central America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces spikes of violet to purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a strong, minty scent. Salvia verapazana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional medicinal uses.
